--- title: "Randomized Controlled Trials" --- ::: {.cell hash='06_rct_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_517c0a72484f31daf3555cc5a52ef698'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load necessary libraries library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'tidyverse' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'tidyr' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'readr' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'purrr' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'forcats' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Paket 'lubridate' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr 1.1.3 ✔ readr 2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.4 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr 1.0.2 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Load the data abtest_data <- readRDS("C:\\Users\\Deniz\\Documents\\GitHub\\Causal_Data_Science_Data\\abtest_online.rds") # Explore the data head(abtest_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} summary(abtest_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> ip chatbot previous_visit mobile_device #> Length:1000 Mode :logical Min. : 0.000 Mode :logical #> Class :character FALSE:496 1st Qu.: 1.000 FALSE:683 #> Mode :character TRUE :504 Median : 1.000 TRUE :317 #> Mean : 2.021 #> 3rd Qu.: 3.000 #> Max. :13.000 #> purchase purchase_amount #> Min. :0.000 Min. : 0.00 #> 1st Qu.:0.000 1st Qu.: 0.00 #> Median :0.000 Median : 0.00 #> Mean :0.381 Mean :13.14 #> 3rd Qu.:1.000 3rd Qu.:27.44 #> Max. :1.000 Max. :81.35 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Check covariate balance across groups covariate_balance_plot <- ggplot(abtest_data, aes(x = chatbot, y = mobile_device, color = chatbot)) + geom_boxplot() + labs(title = "Covariate Balance Check", x = "Chatbot", y = "Mobile Device") + theme_minimal() # Display covariate balance plot print(covariate_balance_plot) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](06_rct_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Run a regression to find the effect of chatbot on sales (purchase_amount) regression_model <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visit, data = abtest_data) summary(regression_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visit, #> data = abtest_data) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -25.414 -14.428 -8.435 12.559 64.584 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 15.2840 1.1227 13.614 < 2e-16 *** #> chatbotTRUE -6.8488 1.1792 -5.808 8.49e-09 *** #> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.8562 1.2642 -0.677 0.49841 #> previous_visit 0.7792 0.2869 2.716 0.00673 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 18.6 on 996 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.04243, Adjusted R-squared: 0.03954 #> F-statistic: 14.71 on 3 and 996 DF, p-value: 2.228e-09 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Find subgroup-specific effects by including an interaction term interaction_model <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device + previous_visit, data = abtest_data) summary(interaction_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device + previous_visit, #> data = abtest_data) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -25.403 -14.450 -8.445 12.549 64.562 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 15.27384 1.19130 12.821 < 2e-16 *** #> chatbotTRUE -6.82837 1.42580 -4.789 1.93e-06 *** #> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.82375 1.79309 -0.459 0.64605 #> previous_visit 0.77914 0.28711 2.714 0.00677 ** #> chatbotTRUE:mobile_deviceTRUE -0.06455 2.52907 -0.026 0.97964 #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 18.6 on 995 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.04243, Adjusted R-squared: 0.03858 #> F-statistic: 11.02 on 4 and 995 DF, p-value: 9.485e-09 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Compute CATE for mobile users mobile_users_effect <- coef(interaction_model)["chatbotTRUE:mobile_deviceTRUE"] # Run a logistic regression for binary outcome (purchase) logistic_model <- glm(purchase ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visit, family = binomial(link = 'logit'), data = abtest_data) summary(logistic_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> glm(formula = purchase ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visit, #> family = binomial(link = "logit"), data = abtest_data) #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|) #> (Intercept) -0.22185 0.12347 -1.797 0.07237 . #> chatbotTRUE -0.96894 0.13564 -7.144 9.09e-13 *** #> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.07119 0.14530 -0.490 0.62417 #> previous_visit 0.10606 0.03262 3.252 0.00115 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> (Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1) #> #> Null deviance: 1329.1 on 999 degrees of freedom #> Residual deviance: 1262.2 on 996 degrees of freedom #> AIC: 1270.2 #> #> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4 ``` ::: ::: 2. chatbotTRUE: The estimated change in purchase_amount when chatbot is TRUE compared to when it is FALSE. A negative coefficient suggests that the presence of a chatbot is associated with a decrease in purchase_amount. 3. The CATE for mobile users (chatbotTRUE:mobile_deviceTRUE)is -0.06455 in the model. However, this coefficient is not statistically significant, indicating that there is no significant distinction in the impact of the chatbot on sales (purchase_amount) between mobile and non-mobile users. 4. Coefficient for chatbotTRUE in the logistic regression model is -0.96894. Therefore: A negative coefficient suggests that the presence of the chatbot is associated with a decrease in the log-odds of making a purchase compared to when the chatbot is not present. It implies that customers exposed to the chatbot are less likely to make a purchase (purchase = 1) compared to those not exposed, according to the model.
